div1.p: Lazear expresses his hopes that Sweitzer will visit him.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 21, 1898
div1.p:
Your letter
of Aug 19! reached me
yesterday. Perhaps it
is just as well for
you to give up the Bedford
trip now that it is
so late in the season.

It will probably be
cold. I had expected
great things from your
stay there and I am
disappointed that you
have not been able
to try it.

I hope you will be
back to Baltimore soon.
I suppose you are
going to Windsor at
first. I hope you
will make as a visit
when we get settled
in our new house
wherever that may
be.

I was at Windsor
yesterday all are well,
and pleased that
Uncle Tom is coming
soon.

I know Mabel would enjoy staying
with you in New York, but as she
does not go to Yarmouth until next
Wednesday she will not have a very
much time with her mother and
Nellie. However I shall deliver
your invitation at once.
I have not heard from Dr. Eastman
